page.title: 17MEDIA.
page.content: Most houses in the village are equiped with radio and television. Some have video recorders also. A lot of the information and ideas of the young people are gleaned from these sources. Older people enjoy the daily newspapers. Very few of the serious papers are sold in the village, but many people read the Daily Mail, Express, Mirror and Star. Most popular with the older residents are the local papers. The Eastern Daily Press, and the weekly Dereham and Fakenham paper known as the Journal. Village events are reported in the local press by the village correspondant. Other local news is reported on Radio Norfolk. The village has been featured on the Keith Skipper programme(1983) and on Village Voice. It also featured on BBC televisions Look East in 1980.
